Articles.Content:
I keep getting this message whenever I try to use the patcher to update KSP.

***Unable to authenticate with the server: Received malformed data from the server: File not found.*** 

And then it stops, whenever I try to cancel or close it says that it may corrupt my install.

I don't want to download the the whole KSP install again, that'll kill my bandwidth for the month. Some tips?

EDIT:

    05/02/2015 11:11:25 AM [INFO    ]: Squad Patcher 2.0.2.217 (6805581-production b master) - Apollo I Edition05/02/2015 11:11:25 AM [INFO    ]: ---------------05/02/2015 11:11:25 AM [INFO    ]: OS: Windows (win)05/02/2015 11:11:25 AM [DEBUG   ]: Handing everything over to Qt. Hold onto your butts.05/02/2015 11:11:38 AM [DEBUG   ]: Crash?05/02/2015 11:11:38 AM [INFO    ]: >>> Preparation05/02/2015 11:11:38 AM [INFO    ]: Detecting if OS-resident rsync is present...05/02/2015 11:11:38 AM [WARNING ]: rsync is not already installed, so making use of bin\rsync.exe.05/02/2015 11:11:38 AM [INFO    ]: >>> Authentication05/02/2015 11:11:38 AM [INFO    ]: Getting login token...05/02/2015 11:11:38 AM [DEBUG   ]: HTTPFetcher()05/02/2015 11:11:38 AM [DEBUG   ]: Hashing password05/02/2015 11:11:38 AM [DEBUG   ]: getPatcherExecutable/md5sum myexe05/02/2015 11:11:38 AM [DEBUG   ]: Beginning fetch05/02/2015 11:11:38 AM [DEBUG   ]: Note to testers:  All the data below is hashed and secure.  Please do not file bugs about it.05/02/2015 11:11:38 AM [DEBUG   ]: GetFormData() = username=shannon.calay%40gmail.com&hash=d631317c240efeff3495a14c56470e42&patchermd5=4d36e1d8bebd2a7f084a065df438f4f4&platform=WindowsPlayer&clientsversion=2.0.2.217&act=get_rsync_token&buildTarget=KSP_win&platID=win&password=%2ACA702F34483425320794BC7D516696920744740D&experimental=005/02/2015 11:11:41 AM [DEBUG   ]: Downloading data from https://kerbalspaceprogram.com/kspstore/dp/patcher/index.php to memory...05/02/2015 11:11:41 AM [DEBUG   ]: HTTP 404: Not Found (https://kerbalspaceprogram.com/kspstore/dp/patcher/index.php)05/02/2015 11:11:41 AM [DEBUG   ]: Content-Length: ??? bytes05/02/2015 11:11:41 AM [DEBUG   ]: Received: File not found.05/02/2015 11:11:41 AM [DEBUG   ]: getAuthToken=File not found.05/02/2015 11:11:41 AM [ERROR   ]: Unable to authenticate with the server: Received malformed data from the server: File not found.05/02/2015 11:11:41 AM [ERROR   ]: done[str] signal has 1 argument(s) but 0 provided05/02/2015 11:13:17 AM [WARNING ]: Process closing.  Cleaning up...

That's the patcher.log file.

**Edited <time datetime="2015-05-02T15:30:44Z" title="05/02/2015 03:30  PM" data-short="9 yr">May 2, 2015</time> by Starwhip**
We're aware of the issue, and are looking into it ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

> 
> We're aware of the issue, and are looking into it ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

Thank you very much.
Same issue, I need to patch it and can't download where I currently am for the life of me, would like to figure out why it wont work.

> 
> Same issue, I need to patch it and can't download where I currently am for the life of me, would like to figure out why it wont work.

> 
> We're aware of the issue, and are looking into it ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

They're working on it. ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif)
I'm hoping this gets fixed soon so I can get 1.0.2...

> 05/02/2015 11:11:25 AM [DEBUG ]: Handing everything over to Qt. Hold onto your butts..

This is why we love you guys, SQUAD ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif)

> 
> This is why we love you guys, SQUAD ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif)

I know, right? ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)
Any news on this issue? It has been quite a while.

As the problem still does not seem to be solved, I'm downloading from the KSP Store now.

Ah, well.
Not so great for those of us who have a lot of mods, huh? I was hoping the days of deleting and reinstalling 20+ mods every micropatch were over.
Eh I don't complain plus it's quicker for my computer with downloading the zip file
I know this has been dead for a few weeks but.. any word of a fix for this problem or should i just redownload ksp 1.0.4?
I wish they would fix this. It'd be very useful.

This is still an issue. Trying to patch to 1.0.5 and patcher says "malformed data, blah blah blah."

Do I have to re-install the the whole game to get the update? I purchased through KSP store. (##$#@!! Steam)

> 
> This is still an issue. Trying to patch to 1.0.5 and patcher says "malformed data, blah blah blah."
> Do I have to re-install the the whole game to get the update? I purchased through KSP store. (##$#@!! Steam)

For the moment, redownloading the game from the KSP store through your account seems to be the only way. Unless you've got KSP on Steam.
